item.content:encoded:
Let's both pretend your first post didn't happen because we know that was based on an older setup :P No disrespect to that person, they're my old village-mate now quit, but that was a year ago. You suggested Crimson Lotus but that ride is redundant… so instead I was just talking about the two from the 28th.
Anyway I think kwigyo's thinking that 'the only real obstacle is the speed one' is pretty sound, because after all you can do the whole ride with very high stats thanks to the MachEleven, unlike the Crimson Lotus which was originally designed for it. Your durability may start low, but that is why there are 3 Emergency Countermeasures. It shouldn't be too difficult aside from that one obstacle, assuming you don't have awful bad luck for some reason.

Considering how at this point you would already have Cipher2, rides cost no stam, and there's nothing after this* but two trophies, people shouldn't be in too huge a rush to beat it instead of powering up their ride and stuff. On the other hand this is the F2F2 page: players would be doing this who-knows-how-long after they've beaten F2F1… and considering how they're nearly identical, why they would even have a problem with it at this stage is beyond me.

*The "Calling" Theme, which has never done what it promises due to there being no Reaper's game yet, is only useful for getting the Player Pin, which itself is only useful for unlocking the non-existent Reaper's Game. It's now even more awful in that it must be activated in place of the theme Power of Sound which is irreplaceable for Glowslinging (which of course happens each and every day once unlocked).

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Yes, it is easy. Yes, we know The White Witch increases speed, that's why it's recommended. As he says I believe you can reach 24 speed, however this is only if you have the majorkai upgrade police lights from the sexy lady cops or instead are RedEye bloodline (which at time of writing is not advisable in the slightest). The former is of course not possible in Tier2, however this setup will work for people there anyway. The percentage chance [for that one hurdle] will of course depend on your circumstances going in, (more on this below) but regardless, if you have 40% chance it is more than enough for this situation. For a ride you can do 7-9 times a day WITHOUT awesome in rides, the only real restrictive factor is the cards. But, at this point you have access to Extra Hard rides, which are the best place to farm tips. The setup also uses only one Style card, but if you have the village upgrade in question, correct me if I'm wrong but I believe you can then eliminate the style card with no major consequence (unless you're for some reason trying this redeye).

Regarding the two earlier posts (I meant to reply to those last month…), let's look at the Drive stats for that one Speed 24, 9d3s check. Base 11, The White Witch +1 (Passenger), Basic Turbo +1 (Common Equip), Infinite Potential +1 (lasting D-Ability), Initial Drive +10[once] (D-Ability), (Wasteland Highway +1 (village upgrade from custom kaiju 1 EvilTaxi), and Driving Music +1 (perm drop from custom kaiju 12 Dave). So that makes 14 for the ride, +10 once, +1 from village, +1 from perm. Up to 26 Drive for the speed hurdle, 9d3s makes… 92%? 49% if you're riding T2 or lacking 1 speed for some other reason. Although you could consider incorporating the equip Safety Harness if you think it would help, this setup is both strong and versatile as it is.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Is it just me or does this ride seem really easy? With 13 in all stats (11+1 for White Witch and +1 for the entire ride D-card) and then other bonuses like the gloves, the only problem is D-speed. Which, with this setup is taken care of. Using the Max Speed D-card immediately, you have 23 speed. The only thing that becomes a problem is the 10d3 (9d3 +1 speed difficulty, the penalty isn't even present as a RedEye) which is countered by the +10 drive D-card. 23 levels for 3 successes is a 40% chance success as nonRedEye, but as a RedEye it's a 86% chance

I'm not sure I'm confident enough in this to add it to the page itself, but after trying and failing with the vehicle configuration recommended on the page, I had better luck with this one:

Vehicle: Crimson Lotus
Equipment: Ridiculous Spoiler, Cobalt Supercharger, The Roar
D-Abilities: Beyond the Limit, Emergency Countermeasures, Infinite Potential, and 2 Flat-Out Run
Jacket: at least the Wasteland Delivery Jacket (300 Drivetrain)

Requires playing your cards right and a bit of luck with the RNG, but it worked for me.
